alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 13 at 2:41PM CST until December 15 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southerly then eventually northwesterly winds with sustained speeds 30 to 40 mph and gusts near 65 mph are possible. Isolated higher gusts are not out of the question. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From 9 AM CST Wednesday morning through 9 PM CST Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Through midday Wednesday, winds across the area will be southerly. Through the afternoon hours, winds will turn more westerly, then northwesterly, as a cold front passes through the area. The strongest winds are expected to be out of both the south and northwest.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
